text: Tok Pisin (pronounced: ) is a market language used in parts of the South Pacific, mainly Papua New Guinea and the Solomon Islands, but also in areas of Vanuatu, where a second language known as Bislama is also spoken. A market language is one which is used as an everyday language between people who don't speak a common language. Tok Pisin is a Creole language, meaning that it's a mixture of other languages, mainly English, German and Tahitian. == Related pages == * Languages of Papua New Guinea * Languages of New Zealand * Languages of Australia Category:Languages of Oceania Category:Pidgins and creoles
